thread.title: How uni kids exposed a $77bn lie
thread.title_full: How uni kids exposed a $77bn lie

title: How uni kids exposed a $77bn lie
text:
The who, what and why of Volkswagen’s diesel scandal HARRY TUCKER news.com.au The who, what and why of Volkswagen’s diesel scandal HARRY TUCKER news.com.au VW boss quits over diesel scandal 1:35 
Volkswagen CEO Martin Winterkorn has resigned after a meeting with his board, taking responsibility for the German carmaker's rigging of U.S. emissions tests in the biggest scandal in its 78-year history. Ivor Bennett reports September 24th 2015 a day ago /video/video.news.com.au/News/ 
THE Volkswagen Group is the world’s largest automaker but four university researchers may have brought it to the edge of collapse. 
It was publicly revealed last week that the company had fudged emissions tests using cheat software on diesel powered cars under its three mainstream brands, Volkwagen, Audi and Skoda. 
The result? $41.5 billion wiped from the company’s value, up to $25 billion in penalties from the US alone, on top of the costs to recall and fix 11 million cars worldwide. Other Stories
